title: Quiz 2: Communication & Treatment Modalities
topicName: KMTC Mental Health Notes  Comprehensive Notes
description: Test your mastery of therapeutic communication techniques, the nurse-patient relationship, and psychiatric treatment modalities including pharmacology and ECT.

questions.question: Which of the following is a NON-therapeutic communication technique that limits the client's freedom to think or act?
questions.explanation: Agreeing is non-therapeutic because it indicates the client is 'right', which implies the opposite is 'wrong', limiting their freedom to change their mind. It introduces judgment.
questions.hint: Think about which option implies judgment or taking sides.

questions.question: Match the phase of the Nurse-Patient Relationship with its primary task:
questions.explanation: Pre-orientation: Self-awareness (before meeting). Orientation: Contract/Rapport (first meeting). Working: Problem solving (longest phase). Termination: Evaluation (ending).
questions.hint: Connect the timeline (before, start, during, end) to the specific nurse activity.

questions.question: Which of the following are Extra-Pyramidal Side Effects (EPS) commonly associated with antipsychotic medication? (Select all that apply)

richContent.content: Note: These effects affect motor control and muscle tone.

questions.explanation: Dystonia, Oculogyric crisis, Akathisia, and Pseudoparkinsonism are EPS. Hypertension crisis is associated with MAOIs, not typically referred to as EPS.
questions.hint: Look for symptoms related to muscle movement, spasms, or restlessness.

questions.question: The therapeutic serum level for Lithium should be approximately ___BLANK___ mEq/L.
questions.explanation: The therapeutic serum Lithium level is approximately 1.0 mEq/L. Levels < 0.5 are rarely therapeutic, and > 1.5 are toxic.
questions.hint: It is a single whole number with one decimal place.

questions.question: What is the only ABSOLUTE contraindication for Electroconvulsive Therapy (ECT)?
questions.explanation: Raised Intracranial Pressure (ICP) is the only absolute contraindication because ECT increases cerebral blood flow and ICP, risking brain stem herniation.
questions.hint: Think about the physical pressure changes inside the skull during a seizure.

questions.question: Name the specific drug given as a pre-medication before ECT to dry secretions and counteract vagal stimulation.
questions.explanation: Atropine (0.6 mg IM) is administered ~30 minutes before ECT to dry secretions and prevent vagal bradycardia.
questions.hint: It is a common anticholinergic drug.

questions.question: A patient taking MAOIs eats aged cheese and drinks wine. Which serious complication are they at risk for?
questions.explanation: Tyramine-rich foods (cheese, wine) combined with MAOIs can cause a Hypertensive crisis (severe headache, nausea, high BP).
